page.title: 03Religion:Survey of Kingswood
page.content: {St. Andrew's}was opened by the Bishop of Buckingham on{St. Patrick's Day {1960.}These two{churches}belong to the {Church of England. Most children at{Kingswood}took part in a survey which shows the different {religions}followed. 100 families are {Church of England,}19 families are {Muslims,}20 are{Catholics,}8 are {Baptists,}3 are{Jehovah's Witnesses, 3 are{7th Day Adventists,}2 are {Pentecostals, 2 Methodists.}One family is of the{Mormon faith.}59 families do not attend a regular church service. Many{Muslims}in the area pray at the {Mosque}in{High Wycombe.}The women and girls usually{worship}at home, using a prayer mat which must face in the direction of{Mecca.}We have an Assembly every day at{Kingswood school where all the children can pray together.
